entry.title: SAP Inside Track Pune 2025 ‚Äî A Celebration of Ideas, Energy, and Collaboration
entry.content:
Once again, the SAP community in Pune showed its strength, passion, and drive. On 11th October 2025, SAP Inside Track Pune returned for its second edition ‚Äî and it was nothing short of spectacular.

A Community Reunion

From the moment doors opened, the buzz in the air made it clear: this wasn‚Äôt just an event ‚Äî it was a community coming together. Over 200+ enthusiastic participants, 20+ speakers, and a dedicated team of volunteers gathered at SAP Labs India, ITPP, Pune to learn, share, and grow. The energy, camaraderie, and excitement were palpable.

ü§ù Voices That Inspire

We kicked off with an inspiring keynote by Saicharan Krishnamoorthy, tracing the journey of SAP Inside Track and spotlighting how far Pune has come on its SAP path. The stories shared, insights revealed, and vision laid out set a vibrant tone for the day.

The main stage was beautifully hosted by Punith Oswal (@Punith_Oswal), SAP Champion and member of the SIT core team. His energy and expertise set the perfect tone for the day‚Äôs sessions.

A Day of Deep Dive Learning

This year‚Äôs focus ‚Äî Business AI in SAP ‚Äî resonated through every session and conversation. From AI Strategy to Embedded AI, SAP BTP, modernization, and partner innovations, speakers took us on a rich journey of possibilities. Every talk, every case study, and every Q&A added layers of real-world relevance, innovation, and practical wisdom.

Sessions and Tracks

The event featured a variety of sessions divided across four different tracks, allowing attendees to dive deep into the topics that piqued their interest. Each session was packed with invaluable insights and the latest trends in the SAP ecosystem:

Gratitude to Our Pillars

Events like this don‚Äôt happen on their own. A heartfelt thank you to:

Our Esteemed Partners: Amazon Web Services, Rojo Integrations B.V , Mindset Consulting LLC,  Primus TechSystems, SAP Press - Your support and belief made this event a great success!

Our speakers, for generously sharing your stories, expertise, and bold ideas.

Our core team and volunteers, who poured time, energy, and love into every detail ‚Äî from logistics to hello smiles.

A huge shout-out to Saicharan Krishnamoorthy (@saicharank ) and Devprasad Kambli (@Devkambli) for leading the team from the front, your efforts went above and beyond to make sure everything came together flawlessly!

Unforgettable Moments and Key Takeaways

One of the standout aspects of SAP Inside Track Pune 2025 was witnessing the sheer enthusiasm and energy of Pune‚Äôs vibrant tech community. Professionals, learners, and SAP enthusiasts from across India came together to share knowledge, exchange ideas, and explore the latest innovations in the SAP ecosystem ‚Äî creating an atmosphere that was truly inspiring. The presence of participants who travelled from cities like Bangalore, Hyderabad, and Mumbai added incredible diversity and a sense of unity to the event.

Beyond the sessions and keynotes, the event was filled with opportunities to connect, collaborate, and build lasting relationships. Participants engaged with peers, SAP experts, and thought leaders ‚Äî sparking discussions that could lead to new collaborations, innovative solutions, and enhanced skills across SAP technologies and integration.

SIT Pune 2025 was more than just an event; it was a celebration of community, curiosity, and collaboration. Everyone ‚Äî from attendees to speakers, volunteers, and partners ‚Äî walked away with valuable insights and experiences, contributing to something truly special in Pune‚Äôs SAP ecosystem.

Looking Ahead

Reflecting on the success of SIT Pune 2025, the excitement for the future is palpable. Pune has firmly established itself on the SAP map, and this is just the beginning. The energy, passion, and ideas shared during this event have laid a strong foundation for even bigger opportunities, collaborations, and innovations in the years ahead.

Let‚Äôs keep the momentum going! If you couldn‚Äôt attend, make sure to follow our SAP Inside Track Pune pages on LinkedIn and join the SAP Pune Community group for updates, future events, and exclusive content.

The future of SAP in Pune is brighter than ever ‚Äî and we‚Äôre only getting started! 

A heartfelt thank you to everyone who made SIT Pune 2025 such a tremendous success. Here‚Äôs to many more milestones, learning, and moments of inspiration for the SAP community in Pune and beyond.

 

Until Next Time....

Cheers!

SAP Community Pune - Core Team

entry.title: Re: MRN2 transaction adding +1 devaluation indicator on e...
entry.content:
Hi Vishal,
As you explain the behavior described in the MRN2 transaction‚Äîwhere it adds +1 to the devaluation indicator on each run regardless of the last goods receipt year‚Äîis a known issue when the configuration or logic doesn't properly account for the material's movement history. This is expected behavior of MRN2 should evaluate the last goods receipt year and assign a devaluation indicator based on the configured time frames (e.g., 1 year, 2 years, etc.). This is actual behavior to increments the devaluation indicator by +1 each time it's run, ignoring the actual last goods receipt date.

The root cause is if this typically occurs when the system isn't correctly referencing the last goods receipt year during the MRN2 run. Instead, it applies a default progression logic.
SAP Note 691022 discusses this issue and suggests that the standard module may lack sufficient interface parameters to handle split valuation or materials without recent movements

To fix this one my recommendation is to write User Exit EXIT_SAPLNIW1_002, Implement or enhance this user exit to include logic that checks the last goods receipt year and maps it to the correct devaluation indicator.
You may need to extend the interface with parameters like I_BWTAR and I_OLD_ABWKZ to handle valuation types and previous indicators.

Custom Development: If standard functionality is insufficient, consider a custom enhancement that, Retrieves the last goods receipt date. Maps it to the correct time frame (e.g., 0‚Äì1 year, 1‚Äì2 years). Assigns the corresponding devaluation indicator and percentage.

Please check the configuration by reviewing your devaluation indicator configuration in customization ensure each indicator is correctly mapped to a time frame. Validate that the logic used in MRN2 references these mappings dynamically rather than incrementally.

Hope above solution might work for you

You can visit this url and get some related information might help you. https://www.stechno.net/repository/sap-notes.html?id=691022#gsc.tab=0

entry.title: Add your own App Info section to App Support (SAP S/4HANA 2025)
entry.content:
App Support already lets you enhance menu and submenu structures with customer-specific information (see my previous post for an example). With SAP S/4HANA 2025, there is now an official enhancement point for the first view of App Support as well. That means you can add your own App Info section with minimal effort‚Äîfor example to show support contacts, usage notes, or system-specific hints right where users need them.

Result of enhancement

What you‚Äôll build

  • A new App Info section called ‚ÄúHello World Example‚Äù
  • Two example entries for your new section

Good to know before you start

  • Available with SAP S/4HANA 2025 (uses a new enhancement location).
  • Implemented via BAdI /UI2/ADE_APP_INFO_PROVIDER inside Enhancement Spot /UI2/ADE_DATASOURCE.

Since the App Support plugin is a freestyle app it can only be enhanced in a customer project, or via the predefined extension points. In S/4 HANA 2025 a new enhancement location was introduced, therefore it is now also possible to enhance the first view, with relative little effort. 

 

Step-by-step implementation

In your development system navigate to Enhancement Spot /UI2/ADE_DATASOURCE in transaction SE80.

Step 1: Navigate to Enhancement Spot /UI2/ADE_DATASOURCE

 

In this enhancement spot choose /UI2/ADE_APP_INFO_PROVIDER, which is the BAdI Definition we'll use for the enhancement. 

Step 2: Create a BAdI Implementation for definition /UI2/ADE_APP_INFO_PROVIDER

 

First you will receive a list of already existing Enhancement Implementations. Each implementation represents a data source for the App Support plugin. For our purpose we want to create a new implementation in customer namespace.

Step 3: Create a new BadI Implementation from the overview

 

In the follow up popup enter a meaningful name for your Enhancement implementation. For this example I'm naming it ZBADI_CUSTOMER_INFO.

Step 4: Provide a name and description for your Enhancement Implementation

 

Confirm the name of the implementation and then another popup opens for the BAdI Implementation. Provide your preferred BAdI Implementation name (I simply used the same as for the Enhancement Implementation). More importantly add a name for the new Implementing class. I used ZCL_BADI_CUSTOMER_INFO.

Step 5: Create a BAdI Implementation and Implementing Class

 

You should now have a complete Enhancement Implementation with BAdI Implementation and Implementing class. Activate your changes and ensure the implementation is also flagged as active.

Step 6: Observe the created objects in your Enhancement Implementation

 

If everything is in order, we can now create a new Filter Value for the implementation. This is important, since this value is used to uniquely identify the new data provider in App Support.

Step 7: Navigate to the Filter Values

 

In the Filter Value area create a new Combination, then edit the new Combination directly to add your unique value.

Step 8: Create a new Combination and edit the Filter Value

 

Enter a unique value for the filter value APPINFORMATIONGROUPID.  This value will represent the type of data you want to display in the App Info section of App Support. In this example I use ZCUSTOMERINFO.

Step 9: Enter a unique value for your enhancement 

 

From a enhancement framework perspective we are now good to go. We can now start to work on the actual implementation logic of the customer enhancement in the implementing class of our BAdI.

Step 10: Navigate to the Implementing class of your enhancement

 

Navigate to the ABAP class editor, either in ABAP Development Tools, or directly here in SE80. I'll use SE80 for this example, but of course ADT can be used instead.

Step 11: Open the ABAP class editor for your Implementing Class

 

Since we're in an object oriented environment, it makes sense to inherit some basic attributes from the main App Support data source class.  Therefore navigate to tab Properties and then press button Superclass. 

Step 12 (optional): Navigate to tab Properties and press button Superclass

 

Enter superclass /UI2/CL_ADE_BADI_BASE to make use of the inheritance model in App Support. You can then reuse the authorization check method of the superclass. 

Step 13 (optional): Enter superclass /UI2/CL_ADE_BADI_BASE

 

Now let's get to the implementation logic of our enhancement. Navigate to the Method overview and observe the 3 new methods that need to be implemented from the interface /UI2/IF_ADE_BADI_APP_INFO_PROV. We want to start with the method VERIFY_SOURCE_AVAILABLE to ensure our BAdI is being processed. 

Step 14: Navigate to tab Methods and doubleclick method VERIFY_SOURCE_AVAILABLE

 

This method allows you a dynamic control of your implementation. As input we receive IS_KEYS, which uniquely identifies the currently displayed app, from where App Support is being called. In addition you receive the activity (03=Display, DL= Download). It would be possible to check the availability based on IS_KEYS-APPKEY or base on a customer specific authorization value. Our filter value ZCUSTOMERINFO is added automatically to authorization field SUI_ADEDS of authorization object S_FLP_AS. This could then be used for an authorization check in our class. In this example we keep it simple and always enable our datasource.

Step 15: Enter this code to make sure the BAdI is always executed

 

Here is the code snippet from above:

    "always available or dependent on is_keys
    rv_source_available = /ui2/if_ade_badi_data_provider=>sc_status_available.

Make sure to use the interface attribute sc_status_available('01') and not abap_true('X').

Next navigate to method GET_APP_INFO_GROUP and create a code implementation there. It is important to return the appkey and the groupid. The groupid is the filter value that we entered for our BAdI. This uniquely identifies the source of the provided data. Without the correct value, the data can't be mapped correctly in App Support.

The groupname attribute will be used as section heading in the App Info page.

Step 16: Enter the group information you want to display.

 

Here is the code snippet from above:

    DATA: ls_group TYPE /UI2/ADE_s_APP_INFO_GROUP.

    LOOP AT it_appkey_range ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_key>).
      ls_group-appkey = <ls_key>-low.
      ls_group-groupid = 'ZCUSTOMERINFO'. "same as filter value in BAdI implementation
      ls_group-groupname = 'Hello World Example'.
      APPEND ls_group TO ct_app_info_ext.
    ENDLOOP.

Now we're almost there, only one more method to implement to display our data. Navigate to the final method GET_APP_INFO_GROUP_VALUE. As the name suggests, we can add name value pairs to the new group we defined in GET_APP_INFO_GROUP.

Step 17: Implement method GET_APP_INFO_GROUP_VALUE for your data

 

Here is the code snippet from above:

    DATA: ls_info TYPE /ui2/ade_s_app_info_group_val.
    "for requested apps provide the info extension
    LOOP AT it_appkey_range ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_key>).
      ls_info-appkey = <ls_key>-low.
      ls_info-groupid = 'ZCUSTOMERINFO'. "again add the filter value of the BAdI
      ls_info-valuename = 'Further information on our customer app'.
      ls_info-value     = 'Please do not enter multiple values for the filters at once.'.
      APPEND ls_info TO ct_app_info_ext_val.
      ls_info-valuename = 'Contact Person'.
      ls_info-value     = 'john.doe@customercompany.com'.
      APPEND ls_info TO ct_app_info_ext_val.
    ENDLOOP.

Finally save and activate your changes in your class. After activation check your implementation in an app of your choice and open App Support from there. You should be able to see your enhancemed section right away.

Step 18: Check your enhancement in App Support

 

Tips and troubleshooting

Nothing shows up:

  • Verify that VERIFY_SOURCE_AVAILABLE returns sc_status_available.
  • Confirm your groupid in both GET_APP_INFO_GROUP and GET_APP_INFO_GROUP_VALUE exactly matches the BAdI filter value (e.g., ZCUSTOMERINFO).
  • Ensure all objects and the BAdI implementation are active.

Wrong section title:

  • Adjust ls_group-groupname in GET_APP_INFO_GROUP.

Authorization control:

  • If you need to restrict visibility, use S_FLP_AS and field SUI_ADEDS = your Group ID in VERIFY_SOURCE_AVAILABLE (or call the superclass authorization method if you inherited /UI2/CL_ADE_BADI_BASE).

 Transport:

  • Create all artifacts in the customer namespace (Z* or Y*) and add them to a transport as usual.

 Performance:

  • Keep your GET_* methods lightweight. If you read from the database, do it efficiently and only for the keys in it_appkey_range.

 

Wrap-up

With the new enhancement option in SAP S/4HANA 2025, adding helpful, context-specific information to the first view of App Support is straightforward. Use your own Group ID to define a section, then supply clean name-value pairs to guide users with tips, constraints, and contact details‚Äîright where they look for help.

For Questions and Answers on SAP Fiori ‚Äì please see the SAP Community Q&A area and feel free to post your own questions.
I hope you find this blog post helpful ‚Äì feel free to leave comments and feedback, you can follow the SAP Fiori Launchpad tag to receive updates on blog posts here.

entry.title: New App Support Features in S/4 HANA 2025
entry.content:
If you support SAP Fiori, you know how valuable App Support for the SAP Fiori launchpad can be for getting the right technical context quickly. With the latest update, the app adds three highly requested capabilities that reduce back‚Äëand‚Äëforth and help you pinpoint issues faster:

  1. Display of target mapping parameters
  2. A new enhancement location to show your own customer support information
  3. UI5 error logs and version information

Below is a practical overview of what changed, why it matters, and how to use it.

What‚Äôs new at a glance

See the exact target mapping parameters resolved for the current intent, including defaults and any parameters passed by navigation.
Capture UI5 error logs directly from the end‚Äëuser session and quickly review the SAPUI5 version and loaded libraries.
Provide your own support contact details and links inside the App Support experience using a new enhancement location designed for customer content.


Display of target mapping parameters

What it is:

You can now see the full set of parameters tied to the target mapping of the app you are analyzing. This includes parameters defined in the target mapping, their current values (after intent resolution), and any parameters that were supplied during navigation.

Why it helps:

Clarify why an app opens with a specific filter or variant.
Check whether required parameters are missing or mismatched.
Validate if defaults from the target mapping are being applied as expected.


How to use it:

Enable authorization ADEAPPINFOTMPARAMETERS in field SUI_ADEDS for authorization object S_FLP_AS.  Then open App Support from the same SAP Fiori launchpad session where you experience an issue.

In the App Overview section you will see the new  section Target Mapping Parameters. Compare the resolved values against the expected configuration in your content manager or against the parameters in the URL or tile configuration.
If troubleshooting, capture a screenshot or copy the parameters to include in your ticket, along with the business role/catalog and the semantic object/action.


Tips:

Reproduce the issue first, then open App Support so that the parameters reflect the current user journey.
If multiple target mappings could match the intent, use the list to verify which one was actually selected.

 

New enhancement location for customer information

What it is:

There is a new enhancement location specifically intended for customer content inside App Support. This lets you display your organization‚Äôs support contacts, service hours, and any guidance you want end users to see when they open App Support.

Why it helps:

  • Put ‚Äúhow to get help‚Äù in front of users at the moment they need it.
  • Standardize internal support instructions across apps and roles.
  • Reduce time spent hunting for the right hotline or ticket queue.


How to use it:

Please read my other post on how to implement the enhancement in more detail, following this link:
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/add-your-own-app-info-section-to-app-support-sap-s-4hana-2025/ba-p/14238020

 


UI5 error logs and version information

What it is:

Even though this feature was released in S/4 HANA 2023 I want to mention it here as well. App Support now surfaces UI5 logs captured from the current session, alongside SAPUI5 and FLP version information and loaded libraries. You get a consolidated view similar to what a developer might extract from the browser console, without asking an end user to run developer tools.

Why it helps:

Quickly identify JavaScript errors and warnings raised by the app or shell. Confirm the SAPUI5 version and build level in use on the client. Understand which UI5 libraries and themes are loaded when the issue occurs.


How to use it:

With the problematic app open (or after reproducing the issue), launch App Support in the same session.

Open the UI5 logs and version section. Filter by errors, warnings, or info as needed.
Use the copy/export function to attach logs and version details to your support ticket.

Tips:

If possible, avoid refreshing before opening App Support so the logs include the exact sequence of events leading to the error.
Combine UI5 logs with the target mapping parameters to give a complete picture to your support team or SAP.

Wrap-up

The features described are available with the latest delivery of App Support for the SAP Fiori launchpad. Exact availability depends on your ABAP platform and SAPUI5 release. Refer to the SAP Help documentation for your system version.
No special browser setup is needed to capture UI5 logs via App Support; the app operates within the user‚Äôs launchpad session.

For Questions and Answers on SAP Fiori ‚Äì please see the SAP Community Q&A area and feel free to post your own questions.
I hope you find this blog post helpful ‚Äì feel free to leave comments and feedback, you can follow the SAP Fiori Launchpad tag to receive updates on blog posts here.

entry.title: Miro enhancement
entry.content:
Hi experts ,

i have an FI requirements : an enhancement modifies the standard invoice posting process (MIRO/MIR7) to automatically transfer the Contract Number (EKKO-KONNR) from the Purchase Order (PO) into the invoice line item field (BSEG-VERTN). The Automatic Payment Program (F110) will then use this information, together with the Business Partner (BP) Regrouping Key, to consolidate payments by contract rather than just by vendor.

entry.title: Calculation Utility Rate KPI
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I'm using SAP Business ByDesign and need assistance with creating a KPI for our Utility Rate

I've created a report showing absolute values for Total hours booked on:

  • Customer projects
  • Marketing projects
  • Investment projects
  • Cost collector projects

I want to define a KPI that calculates the Utility Rate as: Sum of hours booked on customer projects / Sum of all booked hours

My challenge:

I'm completely lacking an approach for incorporating this calculation into the KPI. How can I set this up in Business ByDesign?

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you!

Mike

entry.title: Re: How to get the Inventory Value for the Free of Charge...
entry.content:
So in that case, you can consider to use Non-PO GR with Movement Type 511 + Manual Valuation. Movement type 511 allows GR without PO and manual value entry. Can be used for FOC stock if PO-based tracking is not mandatory or

After GR with valuation type FOC, use transaction MR22 to manually post a value to the inventory. This updates the inventory valuation without affecting the PO or invoice. By doing so, it allows valuation reporting on FOC stock but manual step required for each GR.

entry.title: Font size in e-signature form in onboarding
entry.content:
Hi All,

I have configured the PDF for the e-signature for one of my clients and it displays the data collected during the onboarding process.

The problem is with the format of the data. Some fields display with the big font, some with the small font (refer to the attachment).

I tried resolving this by making the field size unique for all fields included in the PDF, but this did not change anything.

I understand that the data source is different (review new hire data, provide personal data collection, additional data collection, free text fields, picklists etc.), however it would be worth unifying the font as the form looks bad and the client does not like it.

Does anyone has the same experience and knows how to this this?

Regards,

Piotr Retecki
